title: Borussia Dortmund boss Thomas Tuchel takes entirely unprovoked pop at Chelsea
text:
Sport Borussia Dortmund boss Thomas Tuchel takes entirely unprovoked pop at Chelsea The German coach - regularly linked with the Arsenal job - clearly doesn't think much of Chelsea's style of play Share Thomas Tuchel has had a subtle dig at Chelsea (Photo: Borussia Dortmund/AFP/Getty) Share Get Chelsea     
It's difficult to criticise Chelsea at the moment. 
Antonio Conte's side are flying. Ten points clear at the top of the Premier League, The Blues are in fantastic form. As well as dominating the division, Chelsea have become a devastating attacking force this season, with Eden Hazard, Pedro and Diego Costa regularly tearing opposition defences to shreds. 
That may be the common consensus… but Borussia Dortmund manager Thomas Tuchel clearly doesn't agree. Thomas Tuchel: not a massive fan of Chelsea tactics, apparently (Photo: Lars Baron) Chelsea: perhaps not massive fans of Thomas Tuchel after hearing these comments (Photo: Darren Walsh) 
Before Conte revolutionised The Blues' style of play, Chelsea had a reputation across Europe for their cagey, defensive tactics - a style that saw them win the Champions League in 2012. 
And it seems Tuchel still sees the Premier League leaders as that sort of side, rather than Conte's cavaliers. (Photo: Getty Images Europe) (Photo: Alexandre Simoes) 
Tuchel's Dortmund side were beaten 1-0 in the first leg of their Champions League last 16 tie against Benfica. Ahead of the second leg, Tuchel was asked if that scoreline meant his team will need to start the game cautiously. Tuchel replied: 
"If I were the coach of Chelsea, Juve or Atletico, maybe I would come up with a different answer. 
"But when the floodlights go on tomorrow night in Dortmund and all the people will support us, then it is about attacking." 
So, essentially, Tuchel has suggested Chelsea are a cautious - i.e. defensive - side. 
Seems a little harsh, doesn't it? Unless, of course, Tuchel is trying to get Arsenal fans on side. In which case, mission accomplished… poll loading Will Thomas Tuchel's next job be in the Premier League? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
